intro: Sedum variicolor, commonly known as the variable stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, white, and yellow, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its adaptability and low maintenance requirements make it a favored plant among gardeners seeking drought-tolerant species.
